question: A train runs with a speed of 200 km/hour. What will be its speed in m/sec?
solution:
Given speed in km/hour = 200 km/hour

Speed in m/sec = (200 x 5) / (18) m/sec = 55.55 m/sec

question: A train crosses a pole in 10 sec and a 200m long platform in 20 sec. What is the length of the train?
solution:
Let the length of train be x meter and speed be y m/sec

Therefore, time taken to cross the pole = x/y sec

and time taken to cross the platform = (Length of train + Length of platform) / speed of train

Therefore x/y = 10
And, (x+200) / y = 20
⇒ 10y + 200 = 20 y
∴ speed of train, y = 20 m/sec
And length of train = x = 10y = 200m

question: Two trains running at 36 km/hr and 54 km/hr are running parallel in the opposite direction. If their lengths are 200m and 300m respectively. Then how much time will they take to cross each other?
solution:
Relative speed, when the trains are running in the opposite direction = Sum of the speed

Therefore, Relative speed = 36 km/hr + 54 km/hr = 90 km/hr
Relative speed in m/sec = (90 x 5) / (18) m/sec = 25 m/sec

Distance covered = sum of the lengths of the train = 200 m + 300 m = 500m
Therefore, time taken = 500m / 25 m/sec = 20 sec

question: A 200 m long train is running at a speed of 60 km/hr. Find out the time it takes to pass a man standing at the platform.
solution:
Speed of the train = (60 x 5) / 18 m/sec = 50 / 3 m/sec
Distance covered in passing the standing person = 200m
Required time taken= 200 / (50 / 3) = 200 x (3 / 50) = 12 sec

question: A train is running at a speed of 264 Km/hr. If the length of the train is 330m, then how long will it take to cross a platform which is 330m long?
solution:
Speed of the train = (264 x 5) / 18 m/sec = 220 / 3 m/sec
Distance covered in passing the platform = (330 + 330) m = 660m
Time taken= 660 / (220 / 3) sec = 660 x (3 / 220) = 9 sec

question: A train which is 264 meter long passes a pole in 12 sec. Find out the speed of train?
solution:
Length of train = 264 m
Time taken to cross the pole = 12 sec
Speed of the train, in m/sec = Length of the train / Time taken to cross the pole
Therefore, speed in m/sec = 264 / 12 m/sec = 22 m /sec
Calculating speed in km/hr = (22 m/sec ) x (18 / 5) = 396 / 5 km/hr = 79.2 km/hr

question: A train 200 m long is running at a speed of 36 km/hr. It crosses a bridge in 30 sec. What is the length of the bridge?
solution:
Speed in m/sec = 36 km/hr x (5 / 18) = 10m/sec
Distance covered by train in crossing the bridge = Speed of train in m/sec x time in sec = 10 m/sec x 30 sec = 300 m
Now, we know that
Distance covered by train in crossing the bridge = Length of train + Length of bridge
Therefore, Length of bridge = 300m - 200m = 100m

question: A train which 360m long takes 36 sec to cross a telegraph pole. How long will it take to cross a 600m long platform?
solution:
Speed of train in m/sec = 360m / 36 sec = 10 m/sec

Distance covered by train in crossing the platform = Length of train + Length of Platform = 360m + 240m = 600m

Therefore, Time taken to cover this distance = 600m / (10 m/sec)
= 60 sec

question: A passenger train running at a speed of 72 km/hr crosses a 400m long platform in 30 sec. What is the length of the train?
solution:
Speed of train in m/sec = 72 km/hr x (5 / 18) = 20 m/sec

Distance covered in meter = Time taken in crossing the platform in sec x speed in meter = 30 sec x 20 m/sec = 600m

Now, we know , Distance covered by train in crossing the platform = Length of train + Length of Platform
Therefore, length of the train = 600m - 400m = 200m

question: The length of train is equal to the length of the platform. Suppose the train is running at a speed of 36 km/hr and it crosses a platform in 2 minutes. What is then the length of the train?
solution:
Speed in m/sec = 36km/hr x (5/18) = 10 m/sec

Given, Time taken by train to cross the platform = 2 min = 120 sec

Therefore, the distance covered by train in crossing the platform = 10 m/sec x 120 sec = 1200 m

Now, distance covered by train in crossing the platform = Length of train + Length of Platform

Given, Length of train = Length of Platform = x

Therefore, 2x = 1200
so, x = Length of train = 1200/2 = 600 m

question: A train takes 24 sec to cross a 480 m platform and 36 sec to cover a 900 m platform. what is the length of the train?
solution:
Let the length of the train be x meter and its speed be y m/sec

Then, ( 2 x 64 ) x [ y / (64 + y)] = 56
∴ Length of train, x = 360m

question: A train 200 m long, running with a speed of 54 km/hr will pass an electric pole in?
solution:
Speed of train = 54 km/hr = 54 x (5/18) = 15 m/sec
Length of train = 200 m
Time taken to pass the pole = Length of train / Speed of train = 200 / 15 = 18 sec

question: A train 270 meters long is moving at a speed of 25 kmph. It will cross a man coming from the opposite direction at a speed of 2 km per hour in?
solution:
Relative speed = (25 + 2) = 27 km/hr = 27 x (5/18) m/sec. = 15/2 m/sec.
Time taken by the train to pass the men. = 270 / (15/2) = 36 sec.

question: A train 110 meters long is moving with a speed of 45 km/hr. A man is running in the same direction as the train at a speed of 5 km/hr. What time will the man take to cross the train?
solution:
Relative speed = (45 - 5) km/hr = 40 km/hr = 40 x (5/18) m/sec = 100/9 m/sec
Distance to be covered = Length of train = 110 meters
Time taken = Distance / Relative speed = 110 / (100/9) = 990/100 = 9.9 seconds ≈ 7 seconds
